body_html:
To follow up: 1. Let's get your patch submitted. 2. Please refactor to move the functionality to tf.contrib.layers; follow all conventions of the code therein (python cleanliness, op and variable names, etc). Ping me when ready for review.
…
On Mon, Jan 9, 2017 at 1:41 PM, Martin Wicke ***@***.***> wrote: ***@***.**** commented on this pull request. Since this function creates variables, I believe this functionality should probably go into layers. We're trying to keep tf.nn to pure functions, so that we can more easily see which changes will lead to checkpoint incompatibilities. — You are receiving this because you were mentioned. body:
To follow up:

1. Let's get your patch submitted.
2. Please refactor to move the functionality to tf.contrib.layers; follow
all conventions of the code therein (python cleanliness, op and variable
names, etc).

Ping me when ready for review.

On Mon, Jan 9, 2017 at 1:41 PM, Martin Wicke <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> *@martinwicke* commented on this pull request.
>
> Since this function creates variables, I believe this functionality should
> probably go into layers.
>
> We're trying to keep tf.nn to pure functions, so that we can more easily
> see which changes will lead to checkpoint incompatibilities.
>
> —
